net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.color

Class AbstractDoubleSegment<SELF extends AbstractDoubleSegment<SELF>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractDatatype
      • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractSimpleDatatypeBase<V>
        • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractSimpleDatatype<V>
          • net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.color.AbstractSegment<Double>
            • net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.color.AbstractDoubleSegment<SELF>
  • Type Parameters:
    SELF - is the generic type of the class itself (bound by the actual final subclass).
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Segment<Double>, AttributeReadMaximumValue<Double>, AttributeReadMinimumValue<Double>, AttributeReadValue<Double>, Datatype, SimpleDatatype<Double>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Factor, Hue

    public abstract class AbstractDoubleSegment<SELF extends AbstractDoubleSegment<SELF>>
extends AbstractSegment<Double>
    This is the abstract implementation of a Segment based on Double.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getValueAsFactor

        public double getValueAsFactor()
        Returns:
        the value in the range from 0 to 1 ([0, 1]).

      • getMinimumValue

        public Double getMinimumValue()
        This method gets the minimum value of this object. A legal value has to be greater or equal to this minimum.
        Returns:
        the minimum allowed for value or null if unbounded.

      • newInstance

        protected abstract SELF newInstance(double value)
        Creates a new instance with the given value.
        Parameters:
        value - is the value.
        Returns:
        the new instance.

      • invert

        public SELF invert()
        Returns:
        a new segment of the same type with the inverted value. Inverted means the complement or technically AttributeReadMaximumValue.getMaximumValue() - AbstractSimpleDatatype.getValue().

      • increase

        public SELF increase(ColorFactor factor)
        Parameters:
        factor - is the ColorFactor to increase by. E.g. 0.0 will cause no change, 1.0 will lead to maximum value.
        Returns:
        a new segment with the value increased by the given factor through linear interpolation.

      • decrease

        public SELF decrease(ColorFactor factor)
        Parameters:
        factor - is the ColorFactor to decrease by. E.g. 0.0 will cause no change, 1.0 will lead to minimum value (0).
        Returns:
        a new segment with the value decreased by the given factor through linear interpolation.
